intro: Campylocentrum parahybunense, commonly known as the Parahyba starfruit, is a tropical plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Marcgraviaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
